instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Reboots
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that is on continous loop (rebooting).

Even with just the board on the bench, it has the same behavier.

The only things the get hot are <CHIP>U4100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

I can't see any obvius oxidation, and I don't know where to start.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Reboots
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass and safe mode?
Run EFI ASD and see if any error pops up.

Also test trying one RAM module at a time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Reboots
threads.message:
Hi,

The mac don't even boot to macos. It's just powering on / off  bettwen a few seconds (2 or 3 seconds) interval.

Even without ram modules, fan or anything else connected it has the same behavier.

On the lab PSU it goes from 0A to 0.4A to 0.8A to 0A, fan spins for a while, and then stops. It seams that it tries to power on, but then powers off.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Reboots
threads.message:
SMC bypass is first to try.

BTW, can you catch voltage on PCH and CPU coils?
Also check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
